page.title: 03Coal Mining.
page.content: The major industry in the area around Crynant has been coal mining. At the present time there are two drift mines in operation, Blaenant Colliery and Treforgan Colliery. Blaenant Colliery is approximately one mile south of Crynant and adjacent to the former Cefn Coed Colliery which is now a 'Coal and Steam Museum'. Treforgan Colliery is situated in the village itself and commenced production in May 1966 to exploit 3 million tons of Anthracite reserves in the Red Vein Seam. At present, 227 men are employed in the driving and servicing of 3 development drifts on a 4-shift pattern. In July 1985, Treforgan Colliery became one of the pits scheduled to be closed on uneconomical grounds by the National Coal Board.
